DataElement.preferredName: Reduced Weight Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Lower Gastrointestinal Tract Involvement Maximum Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the maximum grade or stage of severity of acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant affecting the lower gastrointestinal tract, the small intestine, large intestine (colon), rectum ,and the anus, with onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation in a recipient of reduced weight (less than 50 kg).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Reduced Weight Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Lower Gastrointestinal Tract Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant affecting the lower gastrointestinal tract, the small intestine, large intestine (colon), rectum ,and the anus, with onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation in a recipient of reduced weight (less than 50 kg).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Reduced Weight Acute Graft Versus Host Disease
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Concepts.definition: Made less in size or amount or degree.
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Lower; the bottom one of two.:Definition not available.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Reduced Weight Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Lower Gastrointestinal Tract Maximum Grade
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The largest possible scale of intensity of acute graft versus host disease involving the lower gastrointestinal tract for recipients with reduced weight.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 31 or greater cc diarrhea per kg/per day
